intro: Strophades linearis, commonly known as the slender strophades, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
